analysisLoading.mainMessage:
That's fantastic for your wellbeing! 
Keep it up!

instructions: Press "Start Scan" for a quick 30 second face scan. Follow the instructions on the screen.
Read the instructions on the screen. Press "Start Scan" for a quick 30 second voice scan.
Receive a QR code on screen that links to your personalised wellbeing report!
basicInfo.mainDescription: Please provide your gender and age to receive an accurate and personalised report.

modal.message: Your input for gender and age will determine the reference range provided. Do you wish to proceed?

basicInfoConsent.message: Your input for gender and age will determine the reference range of results provided to you. Do you wish to proceed?

consentDeclined.message: We completely respect your decision. Feel free to contact Ms Suri Tan at contact@universalhealth.ai anytime for any concerns you may have.
consentDeclined.title: Your Privacy, Our Priority

consentScreen.description1: Our technology rPPG allows us to collect non-identifiable data including micro-expressions, heart rate, skin tone, voice modulation, and facial blood flow. We preserve data utility and anonymity through:

list.description: Instead of storing facial or voice recordings, we extract and store data about mathematical variables and derived features.
list.title: Micro-expressions & Voice Modulation

list.description: Instead of storing exact skin tone, we normalise the data (e.g., converting skin tone to a generalised index) so that it reflects physiological changes, like stress-induced flushing, without identifying characteristics like specific skin colour.
list.title: Skin Tone

list.description: Heart rate data can be stored in its original form (as it's non-identifiable)
list.title: Heart Rate

list.description: Similar to heart rate, facial blood flow data is physiological and can be anonymised by storing only indicators (e.g., changes in blood flow reflecting stress).
list.title: Facial Blood Flow

consentScreen.mainDescription: <text><highlight>We are not using your data to train our AI.</highlight> We conduct 30-second facial and audio scans to analyse non-identifiable data like micro-expressions, heart rate, skin tone, voice modulation, and facial blood flow. This helps assess stress, anxiety, and depression levels without identifying you.</text>

exitConfirmation.message: Exiting this page will delete your report and all associated data immediately. Are you sure you want to exit?

facialAnalysis.cameraError: Unable to access the camera. Please check your permissions.
facialAnalysis.faceObstructed: Face is partially obstructed. Please remove any mask or cap.
facialAnalysis.multipleFaces: Multiple faces detected. Please make sure only one person is doing the scan at any one time.
facialAnalysis.noFaceDetected: No face detected or partially obstructed. Remove any glasses, mask, or cap and align your face within the circled frame.
facialAnalysis.tooMuchMovement: Too much movement detected. We are as excited as you, but please hold steady for just 30 seconds!

report.auto-close-message_one: This page will automatically close in {{count}} second.
report.auto-close-message_other: This page will automatically close in {{count}} seconds.
report.copy-sent-message: We’ve sent a copy of the report to your email.

anxietyLevels.text: Regularly monitoring your anxiety levels is important, as chronic anxiety can lead to serious health issues such as panic attacks, depression, and increased risk of heart disease.
By keeping track, you can take proactive steps to manage your mental health and prevent these complications.
It's completely normal to feel anxious from time to time. Many people experience anxiety in their daily lives, whether it's before an important meeting, public speaking, or facing new challenges.

This tool helps you understand your emotional state, but if you feel like your anxiety is significantly affecting your daily life or well-being, it’s always okay to reach out to a mental health professional for support and guidance.
*Drinking alcohol before the night, certain medications or medical devices (e.g. pacemakers) can cause inaccurate reading.

bloodOxygenLevels.text: Regularly monitoring your blood oxygen levels is crucial, as low levels (hypoxemia) can lead to serious complications, including organ damage and severe symptoms like dizziness and disorientation.
By keeping track, you can detect potential health issues early and take proactive steps to maintain your well-being.
*Certain medications or COVID-19 infections in some individuals may lead to a lower reading.

bloodPressure.text: Regularly monitoring your blood pressure helps detect early signs of hypertension or hypotension, which can lead to serious issues like heart disease, stroke, or kidney problems if left unmanaged.
By keeping track, you can take proactive steps to maintain your health and prevent life-threatening complications.
*Smoking, drinking caffeinated beverages or exercising within 30 minutes can cause inaccurate reading.

depressionLevels.text: Regularly monitoring your depression levels is crucial, as untreated depression can lead to serious health issues such as cognitive impairments, including memory loss, and increased risk of heart disease.
By keeping track, you can take proactive steps to manage your mental health and prevent these complications.
It’s normal to feel sad, down, or unmotivated from time to time. Life’s challenges, stress, and even changes in your routine can cause temporary feelings of sadness.

This tool helps you understand your emotional state, but if you feel like these feelings continue or become overwhelming, or if they interfere with your daily life, speaking to a mental health professional can provide clarity and support.
*Drinking alcohol before the night, certain medications or medical devices (e.g. pacemakers) can cause inaccurate reading.

restingHeartRate.text: Regularly monitoring your resting heart rate is important, as an elevated rate can signal an increased risk for cardiovascular diseases and other health issues.
By keeping track, you can take proactive steps to improve your heart health and overall fitness.
Result Guide: bpm = beats per minute
Resting heart rate for male at age 18 - 25
*Experiencing stress, drinking caffeinated beverages or exercising within 2 hours can cause inaccurate reading.

stressLevels.text: Regularly monitoring your stress levels is important, as chronic stress can increase the risk of heart disease, diabetes, and immune dysfunction.
By keeping track, you can implement effective management strategies to maintain your overall health and well-being.

It's completely normal to feel stressed from time to time. Stress is a natural response to the demands of work, family, and everyday challenges. It's part of being human and dealing with the responsibilities and pressures that come with life.

This tool helps you understand your emotional state, but if you find that stress is becoming overwhelming or affecting your health, don't hesitate to seek support from a professional. Talking to a counselor or therapist can help you develop effective stress-management strategies.
*Drinking alcohol before the night, certain medications or medical devices (e.g. pacemakers) can cause inaccurate reading.

report.title: Composition of Your Report

result.autoCloseMessage: This page will automatically close in {{seconds}}.
result.completionMessage: Your personalised report is ready for you to view and it's full of helpful tips and recommendations!
result.congratulations:
Congratulations on completing
 your wellbeing screening!
result.glow-festival-completion-message:
Your personalised report will be shown on the next screen.
 Enter your email to get a copy with wellbeing tips and tricks.
result.privacyMessage: As soon as this page closes, your data is deleted from our system (except when you submit your email to store your report). Like we promised, your privacy is our priority.
result.qrInstructions: Your report is well-protected. Scan the QR code to load on your browser.

sound-analysis.low-volume-2: Please speak louder or move closer to the tablet.

voiceScanning.alternate-title-1: Next, we just need a short voice sample to measure your voice pitch, tone, volume, and pace.
voiceScanning.alternate-title-2: We are not tracking or storing the content of your speech.
voiceScanning.alternate-title-3: To aid you in speaking normally, how about answering these questions?
voiceScanning.mainTitle: To continue, we just need a short voice sample from you. You can say anything you want – it won't affect the results.

daily.description: Let's talk about your daily life, including habits, routines, and anything you'd like to work on.
daily.question: How are you doing?

travel.description: Let's talk about what you enjoy about traveling, including the types of places you like to visit and any experiences you love.
travel.question: Do you like to travel?

questions: What is your favourite dish and why?
What is your plan for the day?
Where is your favourite holiday destination and why?
voiceScanning.startInstruction: Press "Start Scan" for a quick 30 second voice scan and begin speaking.
